class_notes:
(Same as ITAL 341 1)
(A history of post-war Italian cinema with a focus on neorealist films and aesthetics in the light of their international resonance. This class will address both major and less known directors and genres, devoting particular attention to historical topics including fascism and antifascism, youth culture, class struggle, terrorism, mafia, migration. Aesthetics topics will include construction of pathos, landscape, memory, and charisma. Authors will include well known personalities such as Roberto Rossellini, Michelangelo Antonioni, Pierpaolo Pasolini, Liliana Cavani, and contemporary filmmakers who are renewing Italian Cinema, such as Alice Rohrwacher, Laura Bispuri, and Pietro Marcello.)
course_description: Close study of the development of a specific national or regional cinema in terms of aesthetic, theoretical, and sociopolitical dimensions. Weekly screenings required.
prerequisites: FILM 102 and (FILM 201 or FILM 202 or FILM 203 or FILM 204) or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
